page.title: 08ANIMAL FARMING
page.content: On a{dairy farm}the farmer milks the cows twice a day (in the morning and evening). First he cleans the dairy and then gets the food ready. He cleans the udders. He puts the milking machine on and starts milking. He then returns the cows to the fields to let them graze. He cleans the dairy out again and gets the milk ready to send to the dairy. Then he checks the cows and calves. He repeats this process in the evening. Some female calves (heifers) and males calves (steers) are kept for{meat.}The farmer buys the calves from auctions to fatten them up and them sell them again. These cows are called{stores.}Some of the farms keep{pigs.}They are kept in piggeries. They are kept intensively, that is a lot of pigs in one building.
